{{Infobox military person |name= Geoffrey Charles Brown |image= Mark Welch speaks to David Hurley 131121-D-HU462-113.jpg |image_size= 250px |alt= |caption= Air Marshal Geoff Brown (left) in November 2013 |birth_date= {{birth date and age|1958|08|01|df=yes}} |death_date= |birth_place= [[Clermont, Queensland]] |death_place= |placeofburial= |nickname= |allegiance= Australia |branch= [[Royal Air Force]] |serviceyears= 1980–2015 |rank= [[Air marshal (Australia)|Air Marshal]] |servicenumber= |unit= |commands= [[Chief of Air Force (Australia)|Chief of Air Force]] (2011–15)
[[Deputy Chief of Air Force (Australia)|Deputy Chief of Air Force]] (2008–11)
[[Air Combat Group RAAF|Air Combat Group]] (2006)
[[No. 82 Wing RAAF|No. 82 Wing]] (2000–03)
[[No. 3 Squadron RAAF|No. 3 Squadron]] (1997–00) |battles= [[Iraq War]] |awards= [[Officer of the Order of Australia]]
[[Legion of Merit|Legionnaire of the Legion of Merit]] (United States)
[[Pingat Jasa Gemilang (Tentera)|Meritorious Service Medal]] (Singapore) |relations= |laterwork= }} [[Air marshal (Australia)|Air Marshal]] '''Geoffrey Charles "Geoff" Brown''' {{postnominals|country=AUS|size=100%|AO}} (born 1 August 1958) is a retired senior officer of the [[Royal Australian Air Force]]. He served as [[Chief of Air Force (Australia)|Chief of Air Force]] from 4 July 2011 until his retirement on 3 July 2015. ==Military career== After studying engineering, Brown joined the Royal Australian Air Force in 1980.{{cite web|url=http://www.airforce.gov.au/Our_People/Our_Leaders/Chief_of_Air_Force/?RAAF-cIPygzYc/Fwxxi5dCKVD3g8SFEpfUGXS|title=Air Marshal Geoff Brown, AO|publisher=Royal Australian Air Force|accessdate=7 September 2013}} He became Officer Commanding [[No. 3 Squadron RAAF|No. 3 Squadron]] in 1997 and Officer Commanding [[No. 82 Wing RAAF|No. 82 Wing]] in 2000. He commanded air transport operations in [[Operation Iraqi Freedom]] in 2003 before becoming Officer Commanding Airborne Early Warning and Control Systems Program Office later that year. He became Commander of the [[Air Combat Group RAAF|Air Combat Group]] in 2006, Director General Capability Planning at Air Force Headquarters in 2007 and [[Deputy Chief of Air Force (Australia)|Deputy Chief of Air Force]] in 2008. Brown became [[Chief of Air Force (Australia)|Chief of Air Force]] on 4 July 2011.{{cite news |title=Brown becomes CAF after RAAF command changeover ceremony |url=http://australianaviation.com.au/2011/07/brown-becomes-caf-after-raaf-command-changeover-ceremony/ |date=1 July 2011 |accessdate=24 July 2011}}{{cite news |title=RAAF rules the skies – and Russell |url=http://news.smh.com.au/breaking-news-national/raaf-rules-the-skies--and-russell-20110701-1gum0.html |work=[[Sydney Morning Herald]] |first=Max |last=Blenkin |date=1 July 2011 |accessdate=24 July 2011}}{{Cite web|url=http://airpower.airforce.gov.au/Contents/About-APDC/About-APDC/Office-of-Air-Force-History/Air-Marshals-of-the-RAAF/134/Air-Marshals.aspx |title=Air Marshals |accessdate=26 July 2011 |work=Air Marshals of the RAAF |publisher=Royal Australian Air Force Air Power Development Centre |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110601193800/http://airpower.airforce.gov.au/Contents/About-APDC/About-APDC/Office-of-Air-Force-History/Air-Marshals-of-the-RAAF/134/Air-Marshals.aspx |archivedate=1 June 2011 }} On 4 April 2014, it was announced that Brown would continue as the Chief of Air Force for an extra twelve months, to July 2015.{{cite news |author=[[Australian Associated Press|AAP]] |title=Air Marshal Mark Binskin has been announced as the new head of the Australian defence force. |url=http://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/2014/04/04/air-marshal-mark-binskin-named-new-defence-force-chief |newspaper=[[SBS News]] |location= |publisher=[[Special Broadcasting Service]] |date=4 July 2014 |accessdate=4 July 2014}} ==Honours and awards== {{BLP sources section|date=January 2012}}
[[File:Order of Australia (Military) ribbon.png|100px]] [[File:Australian Active Service Medal ribbon.png|100px]] [[File:Iraq Medal (Australia) ribbon.png|100px]] [[File:DFSM with Rosette x 4.png|100px]] [[File:Australian Defence Medal (Australia) ribbon.png|100px]] [[File:Legion of Merit ribbon.svg|100px]] [[File:Pingat Jasa Gemilang (Tentera) ribbon.png|100px]]
{| class="wikitable" |- |rowspan=2| [[File:Order of Australia (Military) ribbon.png|60px]] || [[Officer of the Order of Australia]] (AO) || 26 January 2012[http://www.itsanhonour.gov.au/honours/honour_roll/search.cfm?aus_award_id=1145074&search_type=quick&showInd=true It's an Honour] – Officer of the Order of Australia – 26 January 2012
Citation: For exceptional performance of duty, particularly in regard to the development of the Australian Rules of Engagement and Targeting Directive, as the Commander Task Group 633.4, during Operation FALCONER.'' |- | Member of the Order of Australia (AM) || 27 November 2003[http://www.itsanhonour.gov.au/honours/honour_roll/search.cfm?aus_award_id=1055804&search_type=quick&showInd=true It's an Honour] – Member of the Order of Australia – 27 November 2003
Citation: For distinguished service to the Royal Australian Air Force in senior command and staff appointments.'' |- |[[File:Australian Active Service Medal ribbon.png|60px]] || [[Australian Active Service Medal]] || |- |[[File:Iraq Medal (Australia) ribbon.png|60px]] || [[Iraq Medal (Australia)|Iraq Medal]] || |- |[[File:DFSM with Rosette x 4.png|60px]] || [[Defence Force Service Medal]] || |- |[[File:Australian Defence Medal (Australia) ribbon.png|60px]] || [[Australian Defence Medal]] || |- |[[File:Legion of Merit ribbon.svg|60px]] || [[Legion of Merit|Legionnaire in the Legion of Merit]] (United States) || 30 July 2003[http://www.defence.gov.au/news/raafnews/editions/4614/topstories/story02.htm Air Force News] – Legionnaire of the Legion of Merit – 20 July 2003
Citation: Deftly balanced participation in coalition headquarters planning and utilisation functions with his responsibilities as wartime commander to supervise, control and direct Australian forces engaged in complex airspace operations'' |- |[[File:Pingat Jasa Gemilang (Tentera) ribbon.png|60px]] || [[Pingat Jasa Gemilang (Tentera)|Meritorious Service Medal]] (Singapore) || 2014 |} ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[http://www.airforce.gov.au/leaders/caf.aspx Official biography] {{S-start}} {{s-mil}} {{succession box| title=[[Chief of Air Force (Australia)|Chief of Air Force]]| before=Air Marshal [[Mark Binskin]]| after=Air Marshal [[Leo Davies]]| years=2011–2015| }} {{succession box| title=[[Deputy Chief of Air Force (Australia)|Deputy Chief of Air Force]]| before=Air Vice Marshal [[John Blackburn (RAAF officer)|John Blackburn]]| after=Air Vice Marshal [[Neil Hart (RAAF officer)|Neil Hart]]| years=2008–2011| }} {{S-end}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2011}} {{Chief of Air Force (Australia)}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Brown, Geoff}} [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:Australian aviators]] [[Category:Australian military personnel of the Iraq War]] [[Category:Legionnaires of the Legion of Merit]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Officers of the Order of Australia]] [[Category:People from Central Queensland]] [[Category:Royal Australian Air Force air marshals]] {{Australia-mil-bio-stub}}
